```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
m <- sample(10:50, 1) # mass (kg)
h <- signif(runif(1, 1, 20), 3) # height (m)

ans <- m * 9.8 * h # work (J)
dis <- c(0, m * h)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 1)
sc$questions <- sprintf("%g J", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```

Question
========
How much work does the force of gravity do when a `r fmt(m, 1)`-kg object falls a
distance of `r fmt(h, 1)` m?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
Work is force times distance.
$$W = Fd = mgh = (`r fmt(m,1)` \mathsf{\,kg})(9.80 \mathsf{\,N/kg})(`r fmt(h, 1)` \mathsf{\,m}) 
= `r signif(ans, 3)` \mathsf{\,J}$$
